gurmukhi: qUM AiBmwn kY bYT rhI nhI mwnq hY kCu sIK prweI ] byg clo quih sMg kho qumro mgu hyrq TwF knRweI ]701]
transliteration: Toun Abhimaan Kai Baith Rahinahimaanat Hai Kachhu Seekh Paraaee|| Beg Chalo Tuh(i) San Kaho Toumro Mag (u) Heart Thaadh Kanhaaee||701||
translation: “You are sitting here in vanity and do not listen to the advice of anyone; go quickly, because Krishna will be waiting for you.”701.

gurmukhi: hir pws n mY clhoN rI sKI qu khw BXo jo quih bwq bnweI ] sXwm n mory qUM pws pTI ieh bwqn qy kptI liK pweI ]
transliteration: Har(i) Paas Nam Mai Chal-hon Risakhitu Kahaa Bhayo Jo Tuhe Baat Banaaee|| Syaam Na More Toon Paas Pathieh Baatan Te Kaptilakh(i) Paaee||
translation: “O friend! I shall not go to Krishna; why are you talking in vain? Krishna has not sent you to me, because I feel an element of deceit in your talk;

gurmukhi: BI kptI qu khw BXo gÍwrin qUM n lKY kCu pIr prweI ] XyN kih kY isr nXwie rhI kih AYso n mwn ipKXo khUM mweI ]702]
transliteration: Bhikaptitu Kahaa Bhayo Gvaaran(i) Toon Na Lakhai Kachhu Peer Paraaee|| Yon Kah(i) Sir Nyaae Rahikah(i) Aiso Na Maan Pikhyo Kahoon Maaee||702||
translation: “O gopi, you have become a cheat and do not feel another’s pain,” saying this, Radha sat down with bowed head; the poet say, “I have not seen such an ego at any other place.”702.

gurmukhi: iPir AYsy khXo clIXY rI hhw bl mY hir ky pih XyN kih AweI ] hohu n Awqr sRI biRjnwQ hau lXwvq hoN auh jwie mnweI ]
transliteration: Phir(i) Aise Kahyo Chaliyai Rina Hahaa Bal Mai Har(i) Ke Pah(i) Yon Kah(i) Aaee|| Hoh(u) Na Aatar Sribrijnaath Hau Lyaavat Hon Oh Jaae Manaaee||
translation: Then she said thus, “O friend! you go with me, I have come with a promise to Krishna; while coming, I have said this to Krishna, ‘O, the Lord of Braja! do not feel perturbed, I shall go now and persuade and bring Radha with me,’

gurmukhi: ieq qUM kir mwn rhI sjnI hir pY qu clo qij kY duicqweI ] qo ibn mo pY n jwq gXo khXo jwnq hY kCu bwq prweI ]703]
transliteration: It Toon Kar(i) Maan Rahisajnidar(i) Pai Tu Chalo Taj(i) Kai Douchitaaee|| To Bin Mo Pai Na Jaat Gado Kahyo Jaanat Hai Kachhodh Baat Paraaee||703||
translation: “But here you are sitting in your pride; O friend! you go to Krishna, leaving the duality, I shall not be able to go without you; reflect somewhat on another’s words.”703.

gurmukhi: auT AweI huqI qu khw BXo gÍwrn AweI n pUC khXo kCU sorI ] jwih khXo iPir kY hir pY ieh qy kCu lwj n lwgq qorI ]
transliteration: Outh Aaihoutitu Kahaa Bhayo Gvaaran Aaipoochh Kahyo Kachhu Soree|| Jaah(i) Kahyo Phir(i) Kai Har(i) Pai Eh Te Kachhu Soree|| Jaah(i) Kahyo Phir(i) Kai Har(i) Pai Eh Te Kachhu Laaj Na Laagad Toree||
translation: “O gopi! why have you come without thinking? You should have come after consulting some magician; you go and tell Krishna that Radha is not feeling shy of him;

gurmukhi: mo bqIXw jdurwie jU pY kib sXwm khY khIXo su AhorI ] cMdRBgw sMg pRIq kro qum sO nhI pRIq khXo pRB morI ]704]
transliteration: Mo Bateeyaa Jaduraae Jaduraae Joo Pai Kabi Syaam Kahai Kaheeyo Su Dhoree|| Channdrabhagad San Preet Kabi Syaam Kahai Kaheeyo Su Abori||704||
translation: “Tell all my words to the king of Yadavas without hesitation and also say this, “O Krishna! You love only Chandarbhaga and you have no love for me.”704.

gurmukhi: suin kY ieh rwiDkw kI bqIXw qb so auT gÍwrn pwien lwgI ] pRIq khXo hir kI qum sO hir cMdRBgwhu soN pRIq iqAwgI ]
transliteration: Soun(i) Kai Eh Raadhikaa Kibateeyaa Tah So Outh Gvaaran Paain Laagee|| Preet Kahyo Har(i) Kitoum Sau Har(i) Channdrabhagadh(u) Son Preet Tiaagee||
translation: Hearing these words of Radha, that gopi fell at her feet and said, “O Radha ! Krisshan only loves you and he has abandoned his love for Chandarbhaga;
